key_insight: Stream-DiffVSR enables high-quality, perceptual video super-resolution in streaming/online settings by using a causally conditioned diffusion model with a distilled 4-step denoiser and auto-regressive temporal guidance to avoid future-frame dependency and multi-step latency.
problem_solved: Existing diffusion-based VSR methods require future frames and many denoising steps, making them too slow and impractical for latency-sensitive, real-time or streaming applications.
method: Causal conditioning: model operates strictly on past frames (no future frames) to support online/streaming use.
Four-step distilled denoiser: highly accelerated diffusion inference via 4-step distillation for low-latency outputs.
Auto-regressive Temporal Guidance (ARTG): injects motion-aligned, auto-regressive cues to preserve temporal consistency and improve per-frame perceptual quality.
impact: Enables deployment of perceptually strong VSR in real-time/streaming pipelines (e.g., video conferencing, live broadcast, edge devices) by cutting latency and compute while retaining diffusion-quality outputs.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: past frames → ARTG (motion alignment) → 4-step distilled denoiser → enhanced frame (online loop)
Latency vs. perceptual-quality chart: compare Stream-DiffVSR to prior diffusion and deterministic VSR methods (show large quality gain at low latency)
Temporal consistency panel: side-by-side frame sequence (original, baseline, Stream-DiffVSR) highlighting motion fidelity and artifact reduction
Icon row: symbols for ‘no future frames’, ‘4-step speedup’, ‘real-time/streaming’, and ‘high perceptual quality’
paper_title: Stream-DiffVSR: Low-Latency Streamable Video Super-Resolution via Auto-Regressive Diffusion
paper_authors: Hau-Shiang Shiu, Chin-Yang Lin, Zhixiang Wang, Chi-Wei Hsiao, Po-Fan Yu
